For most of my early life (from childhood through part of my undergrad) I worked in construction renovating homes and eventually heavy civil. Then one day while installing moisture sensors for an irrigation system I got a spark of inspiration to change my career trajectory to computers and data. I went on to study my undergrad in Applied Statistics and Computer Science at BYU, after which I jumped right into working full-time as a software engineer. I spent a few years working on satellite software for space situational awareness for the DoD focused mostly on image processing and optimization. I currently work in cybersecurity using big-data analytics and machine learning to track down bad actors.

I consider myself an engineer with expertise in software engineering and intelligent systems focused on cyber-physical systems (IoT, software automation, AI/ML).
